string-array.item: Warsaw is the official capital of Poland, the largest city in this country, which for many centuries has occupied a dominant position in its political and cultural arena. Once one of the most beautiful cities in Eastern Europe, Warsaw was catastrophically severely destroyed during the occupation by Hitlers troops. Despite the fact that many monuments and structures of medieval Warsaw were restored, most of the city was rebuilt in a modern style. Mirrored skyscrapers, busy streets and neighborhoods contrast sharply with the quiet streets and low houses of the Old Town.

Minsk is the capital of Belarus, the largest and most interesting city in the country. The city is the center of the Minsk region and the Minsk region, but is not included in their composition, since it is an independent administrative-territorial unit. The city has 1 million 921 thousand people (2014). You must spend at least 2 days to at least briefly familiarize yourself with its sights.

Moscow is a city of federal significance, a subject of the Russian Federation. The largest in the country and one of the most important in the world political, industrial, scientific and cultural center. Located in the European part of the Russian Federation, between the Oka and Volga rivers, on the Moscow River. The border of the city mainly passes through the Moscow ring road.
